intro: Cyphostemma humile subsp. dolichopus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white flowers that are typically followed by yellow or orange berries. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in shrublands. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
